com.github.iamniklas.colorspaces

Class ColorRGBA

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.iamniklas.colorspaces.ColorRGBA

  • public class ColorRGBA
extends java.lang.Object
    The ColorRGBA class represents a color with red, green, blue, and alpha (transparency) components. It provides methods for color manipulation and conversion to other color spaces.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColorRGBA

        public ColorRGBA(int _r,
                 int _g,
                 int _b,
                 int _a)
        Constructs a ColorRGBA object with the specified red, green, blue, and alpha values.
        Parameters:
        _r - the red component (0-255)
        _g - the green component (0-255)
        _b - the blue component (0-255)
        _a - the alpha component (0-255)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any component is out of range (0-255)

    • Method Detail

      • dim

        public ColorRGBA dim(float _percentage)
        Dims the color by the specified percentage.
        Parameters:
        _percentage - the percentage to dim (0.0-1.0)
        Returns:
        a new ColorRGBA object with the dimmed color
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the percentage is out of range (0.0-1.0)

      • dim

        public ColorRGBA dim(ColorRGBA _c)
        Dims the color by another ColorRGBA object.
        Parameters:
        _c - the ColorRGBA object to dim by
        Returns:
        a new ColorRGBA object with the dimmed color
